resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Charles Péguy founded his journal the Cahier de la Quinzaine in which he published his writings and those of the prominent authors of his time.
resource.chars: Charles Péguy founded his journal the Cahier de la Quinzaine in which he published his writings and those of the prominent authors of his time.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: In Notre Jeunesse, Charles Péguy reviewed France from the 1789 Revolution to the A. Dreyfus Affair. He went back to this affair and the political depravation of France and of Republic. One of his famous quotations is : “Everything begins in mysticism and ends in politics”. According to him, the Dreyfus cas was a question of morality and humanity and not of politics, as Jean Jaurès thought.
resource.chars: In Notre Jeunesse, Charles Péguy reviewed France from the 1789 Revolution to the A. Dreyfus Affair. He went back to this affair and the political depravation of France and of Republic. One of his famous quotations is : “Everything begins in mysticism and ends in politics”. According to him, the Dreyfus cas was a question of morality and humanity and not of politics, as Jean Jaurès thought.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text:
Charles Péguy (1873-1914)

He was one of the Captain Dreyfus’ ardent defenders. He was a socialist, anti-parlementary and catholic writer, very religious and anti-clerical at the same time. He was impregnated with republican mysticism.
resource.chars:
Charles Péguy (1873-1914)

He was one of the Captain Dreyfus’ ardent defenders. He was a socialist, anti-parlementary and catholic writer, very religious and anti-clerical at the same time. He was impregnated with republican mysticism.
